meanings.definition: A person or thing that belts.
meanings.sent1: The singer was a belter, hitting high notes effortlessly.
meanings.sent2: The new belter in town quickly became a crowd favorite.
meanings.sent3: The belter of the group, the little girl surprised everyone with her loud voice.
meanings.sent4: Her voice was a belter, shaking the walls with its power.
meanings.sent5: The belter's performance left the audience in awe.

meanings.sent1: The latest belter on the radio has everyone singing along.
meanings.sent2: The movie was a belter, breaking box office records.
meanings.sent3: The belter of a song got stuck in my head all day.
meanings.sent4: The film was a belter, captivating audiences worldwide.
meanings.sent5: That belter of a song always gets me pumped up.

meanings.sent1: He delivered a belter of a punch, knocking out his opponent.
meanings.sent2: The boxer's belter left his opponent reeling.
meanings.sent3: The belter of a shot hit the target dead center.
meanings.sent4: Her kick was a belter, sending the ball flying into the net.
meanings.sent5: The belter of a punch echoed through the arena.
